Row.Text: You will burn for this, I swear it.
Fool. You have doomed your people to fire and destruction.
Wretched scoundrel! You shall pay for this!
Villain! You are an abomination to heaven and earth. You shall be destroyed!
I curse you and your barbaric people. We shall sweep you from the earth with the great cleansing fire of righteousness.
You are ignorant savages. You must be destroyed.
The barbarians advance, and another great civilization is destroyed. Night is upon us - turn out the lights.
We have been consumed by the fires of hatred and rage. Enjoy your victory in this world - you shall pay a heavy price in the next!
If you do not give us what we want, we will bring down the flames of righteousness upon your cities and destroy you.
Songhai could use your assistance in her fight against the heretics and scum who infest the earth.
Give us what we want or face our wrath.
Greetings. I am Askia of the Songhai. We are a fair people - but those who cross us will find only destruction. You would do well to avoid repeating the mistakes others have made in the past.
Blessings upon you. I am Askia of the Songhai. I seek peace with all, but do not shrink from war when necessary. If you wish to survive, do not make it necessary.
Greetings. I am Askia, king of the Songhai. We are an enlightened people who seek the peaceful exchange of knowledge with others. However, we are quite ready to defend ourselves when necessary.
Greetings. I am Askia of the Songhai. We seek peace with all. If you are looking to make trouble, I urge you to do so elsewhere.
We thank you for bringing an end to this pointless war.
Do not make me angry. You wouldn't like me when I'm angry. Improve your offer or go away.
You must do better than that.
That is not acceptable. Will you not improve your offer?
Is that the best you can do?
Those who seek to cheat us do so at their peril. Please improve your offer.
Can you do a little better?
Do you think we are fools? I should kill you for your arrogance. Leave now, while you are still able.
I cannot agree to your terms. They are unfair to the Songhai people.
Your offer is unacceptable. Is it meant as an insult to us?
Your trading skills almost make up for your many other defects.
That seems fair and equitable. Agreed.
“Please improve your offer so that I can better outfit my armies to wipe your contemptible civilization off of the planet.”
Can I interest you in this deal?
This is a fair trade. I recommend that you accept it.
Ignorant dog! Be glad I do not burn you from the earth for your insolence!.
You would be wise not to press us too hard. Our friendship has its limits.
You dare to threaten me, you, you heretical fool? You must be mad!
Very well. You shall have your pound of flesh. But you shall pay dearly for it someday, I promise you!
We are happy to reward our most steadfast friends and allies!
It appears that I have no choice but to agree to your demands. But there will come a reckoning!
You shall pay a thousandfold for this insult!
You are playing a dangerous game.
Very well. The next time I shall not be so polite!
Indeed? I trust that you will not live to regret your short-sightedness.
It is only because of our mercy that you still exist. Do not test us again!
